item.title: Unable to speak, stand up: Doctors, SKM leaders offer health update on Jagjit Singh Dallewal - The Times of India
item.description:
Health Update on Jagjit Singh Dallewal: Unable to Speak or Stand

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: Times of India

Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a key figure in the ongoing farmer's protests, has reportedly faced severe health challenges, making him unable to speak or stand.

  • Dallewal is currently under medical care.
  • Doctors express concern over his deteriorating health condition.
  • He remains a prominent voice among farmers despite his health issues.
  • Supporters are rallying around him during this tough time.
"His health has taken a turn for the worse, and we are monitoring the situation closely." - Medical Team

The situation calls for immediate attention as Dallewal continues to be an influential leader in the movement.

item.title: Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut | Weather wrap - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Cold wave, dense fog leave north India shivering; schools in Jharkhand shut

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave and dense fog have resulted in freezing temperatures and significantly reduced visibility across northern India, prompting widespread disruptions in transportation.

  • Delhi experienced its longest spell of fog, leading to cancellations of hundreds of flights and trains due to zero visibility conditions.
  • In Jharkhand, schools will be closed from January 7-13 due to the cold wave affecting the region.
  • Kashmir saw fresh snowfall while temperatures dipped to below freezing in various areas, with Kokernag recording minus 8.1 degrees Celsius.
  • Cold conditions persisted in Punjab and Haryana with minimum temperatures dropping significantly.
  • Many schools in Bihar's Patna also closed due to ongoing cold wave conditions.
The maximum temperature in Delhi settled at 18.6 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was recorded at 9.4 degrees Celsius.

As weather conditions remain concerning, authorities anticipate further cold weather and possible rain and thunderstorms in the coming days.

item.title: Parvesh Verma, Arvind Kejriwal's New Delhi rival, makes big 'Sheesh Mahal' attack: 'Declare it...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parvesh Verma Accuses Arvind Kejriwal Over 'Sheesh Mahal'

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Parvesh Verma, a former BJP MP, has launched an attack on AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal, calling for his official residence to be declared a tourist spot as a critique of alleged misuse of taxpayer money.

  • Parvesh Verma has been named the BJP's candidate for New Delhi in upcoming elections.
  • He claims the construction of Kejriwal's 'Sheesh Mahal' used public funds, demanding transparency.
  • Verma stated, 'People should know how Kejriwal looted them,' expressing a desire for public access to the residence.
  • Prime Minister Modi has also criticized the AAP for perceived inaction over the years, promoting the BJP's agenda.
  • Kejriwal has rebutted Modi's criticisms, arguing they detract from the issues faced by Delhi's residents.
“Sheesh Mahal should be declared a tourist spot. The people of Delhi should know how the person who looted, betrayed, Delhi, who sold their dreams, got the 'Sheesh Mahal' built.” - Parvesh Verma

This political rivalry heats up as Delhi heads toward the 2025 assembly elections, showcasing divergent strategies and narratives from the BJP and AAP.

item.title: IC 814 fame Captain Devi Sharan retires: 'Will always be looking at co-passengers to ensure nothing’s wro - The Times of India
item.description:
Captain Devi Sharan Retires: 'Will Always Be Looking at Co-Passengers to Ensure Nothing’s Wrong'

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Captain Devi Sharan, known for his heroic actions during the IC 814 hijacking, has officially announced his retirement, reflecting on his experiences and commitment to safety.

  • Captain Sharan served in a pivotal role during the IC 814 hijacking incident.
  • He emphasizes the importance of vigilance, stating he will continue to observe co-passengers closely.
  • The announcement marks the end of a significant chapter in his aviation career.
"I will always be looking at co-passengers to ensure nothing’s wrong."

In conclusion, Captain Sharan's retirement highlights a legacy of dedication to passenger safety and remarkable leadership in crisis situations.

item.title: Centre rolls back GRAP-3 pollution curbs in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves - The Times of India
item.description:
Centre rolls back GRAP-3 pollution curbs in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves

Publication Date: October 23, 2023

Source: Times of India

As air quality in Delhi-NCR improves, the government has decided to roll back GRAP-3 pollution restrictions previously implemented during poor air quality days.

  • The rollback is a response to the recent improvement in the Air Quality Index (AQI).
  • GRAP-3 measures included actions such as banning construction activities and capping vehicle usage to combat severe pollution.
  • The government will continue to monitor air quality, ready to reintroduce restrictions if necessary.
“The air quality has shown a significant improvement, allowing us to lift these measures.”

This decision to roll back restrictions comes as a relief to residents affected by previous measures, although monitoring will continue to ensure air quality remains within safe levels.

item.title: Hyderabad: Two arrested for ‘voyeurism’ at private college's girls hostel; principal booked - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Hyderabad: Two Arrested for Voyeurism at Girls Hostel as Principal Booked

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Hyderabad police have arrested two suspects for voyeurism following allegations from female students at a private engineering college who claimed that they were filmed in their hostel washrooms.

  • Two individuals accused of secretly filming female students have been arrested.
  • Protests erupted at the college following the allegations.
  • The police lodged a case under voyeurism and POCSO act.
  • The accused were found to have easy access to the washrooms due to their proximity to the hostel.
  • The principal and other officials are also facing accusations for neglecting the matter.

“Voyeurism means an act of secretly watching individuals inside a private infrastructure, a washroom, trial room, etc., with indecent intent.”

Further investigations are ongoing, with implications for the college administration being explored as well.

item.title: GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves | Check restrictions lifted - Hindustan Times
item.description:
GRAP 3 measures revoked in Delhi-NCR as AQI improves

Date: Jan 05, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

The Commission of Air Quality Management (CAQM) has revoked the Stage III restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR due to improving air quality index (AQI) levels.

  • Stage III restrictions lifted due to favorable AQI trends.
  • Stage I and II measures still in effect, including a ban on non-essential construction work.
  • Classes up to grade 5 were previously shifted to a hybrid mode.
  • Restrictions on BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel vehicles in effect, with exceptions for persons with disabilities.
  • Strong advice remains to follow GRAP-II restrictions due to potential changing weather conditions.
"Owing to the favourable meteorological conditions and better wind speed, the AQI of Delhi has been continuously improving" - CAQM's order citing the India Meteorological Department.

This decision comes as the sub-committee will continue to monitor the air quality situation closely.

item.title: AAP MP Sanjay Singh's jibe at PM Modi, BJP: 'Bin dulhe ki baraat' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
AAP MP Sanjay Singh's Jibe at PM Modi: 'A Marriage Procession Without the Groom'

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

AAP MP Sanjay Singh criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi during a rally in Rohini, taking aim at the BJP's failure to declare a chief ministerial candidate ahead of Delhi's assembly elections.

  • Singh mocked Modi's rally comments, stating that nothing would change due to PM's words and highlighting Delhi's pride in Arvind Kejriwal.
  • He claimed the BJP was 'walking ahead with a marriage procession without the groom', referring to their election strategy.
  • Modi had earlier urged Delhi voters to elect a BJP-led government, blaming the AAP for development failures in the capital.
  • Kejriwal reacted by asserting that central government projects wouldn't have happened without AAP's cooperation.
"Nothing will happen because of what PM Modi says in his speech. Delhi takes pride in Arvind Kejriwal and his work... wo bina dulhe ke baraat lekar nikle hain." - Sanjay Singh

The ongoing exchanges between AAP and BJP leaders indicate a heightened political rivalry as the Delhi assembly elections approach.

item.title: 'Roads Like Priyanka Gandhi's Cheeks': BJP Leader Bidhuri's Remark Draws Congress Ire - News18
item.description:
BJP Leader Ramesh Bidhuri's Comment About Priyanka Gandhi Sparks Outrage

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

A political stir erupted after BJP’s Ramesh Bidhuri made an inappropriate comment regarding Priyanka Gandhi, stating that future roads will be like her cheeks if his party wins.

  • The remark drew immediate backlash from Congress, which announced plans to file an FIR against Bidhuri.
  • Delhi BJP chief Virendraa Sachdeva advised leaders to refrain from making derogatory remarks about women.
  • In his defense, Bidhuri later expressed regret and retracted his statement.
  • Congress labeled the BJP as anti-women and demanded accountability from its leadership.
“If anyone is hurt by my remark, I express regret over it and I take my words back…” - Ramesh Bidhuri

The incident reflects ongoing tensions and challenges in political discourse regarding gender sensitivity.

item.title: Indian-origin woman, adopted by Spanish couple, returns to Odisha after 15 years to find birth mother - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin woman, adopted by Spanish couple, returns to Odisha to find her biological mother after being abandoned 20 years ago.

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sneha, a researcher in children's education in Spain, has traveled to India with her Spanish adoptive parents to trace her biological roots after being abandoned at a young age.

  • Sneha was abandoned at a year old and adopted by a Spanish couple in 2010.
  • She is eager to find her biological mother, Banalata, before returning to Spain for educational commitments.
  • The search helped her discover family details with the aid of local community members and police.
  • The Odisha police are involved in assisting Sneha in locating her mother, who is believed to be from Cuttack district.
“The purpose of my journey from Spain to Bhubaneswar is to find my biological parents, especially my mother. I want to find her and meet her.” - Sneha Enrique Vidal

Sneha's journey highlights the emotional quest for identity and familial connection, reflective of many adoption stories globally.

item.title: PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes - The Hindu
item.description:
PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes

Date & Source: January 05, 2025 - The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13-km-long section of the Rapid Rail Transit System (RRTS) on January 5, 2025, connecting Delhi and Meerut, significantly reducing travel time for commuters.

  • The section is between New Ashok Nagar in Delhi and Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh.
  • Travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is now under 40 minutes.
  • Train service frequency is set at 15 minutes starting from 5 p.m. on inauguration day.
  • The fare from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is ₹150 for standard and ₹225 for premium coaches.
  • Foundation stone for the project was laid by Modi in March 2019.
“This project is a ₹30,000-crore initiative that will enhance connectivity.”

The inauguration of this section marks a significant advancement in Delhi's transportation infrastructure, promoting ease of travel between the capital and Meerut.

item.title: 'Take my words back': BJP's Bidhuri first defends, then 'regrets' Priyanka comment - The Times of India
item.description:
'Take my words back': BJP's Bidhuri first defends, then 'regrets' Priyanka comment

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

In a controversial statement, BJP's Bidhuri initially defended his comments regarding Priyanka but later expressed regret, leading to public debates about accountability in political discourse.

  • Bidhuri's comments sparked immediate backlash.
  • His later regret attempts to mitigate the public's response.
  • This incident highlights ongoing tensions within Indian politics.
Bidhuri stated, "I take my words back" as he faced criticism.

This situation raises questions about the responsibility of public figures in their statements.

item.title: Two arrested, Hyderabad college principal among 7 booked after female students accuse staff of filming in - The Times of India
item.description:
Two Arrested, Hyderabad College Principal Among 7 Booked After Female Students Accuse Staff of Filming in Washrooms

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Various News Outlets

After serious allegations from female students about staff filming in washrooms, two individuals have been arrested, including the college principal.

  • The incident involves accusations of staff members secretly filming female students.
  • Authorities have moved quickly, booking seven individuals connected to the college.
  • Legal actions are being taken in response to the breaches of privacy.
  • This has led to protests and demands for accountability from the student body.
“We will not tolerate any infringement of our privacy and will fight for justice,” said a representative from the student union.

This incident calls attention to the need for better safeguarding measures in educational institutions to protect students' rights.

item.title: Goa’s tourism is changing, not dying. People don’t want ‘minibus tourists’ - ThePrint
item.description:
Goa's Tourism: Evolving Beyond 'Minibus Tourists'

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Print

As Goa faces scrutiny over declining tourist numbers, both tourists and locals express frustration about evolving travel norms and rising costs. Officials assert that tourist numbers are robust, while many locals feel that the type of tourists visiting has changed significantly.

  • Social media showcases contrasts between packed tourist spots and empty cafes.
  • Domestic tourists voice complaints about costs and service, labeling some visitors as “minibus tourists.”
  • Government officials assert that tourism remains strong and criticize influencers for negative portrayals.
  • The hospitality industry grapples with a shift in tourist demographics post-pandemic.
  • Many in Goa seek to redefine the destination’s identity amidst ongoing transformations.
“Perhaps what we’re witnessing isn’t so much the death of Goa’s tourism—it’s the end of a particular dream of Goa, steeped in nostalgia.”

The ongoing debate highlights the need for Goa to navigate its identity as it evolves, balancing the needs of its residents with those of new visitors.

item.title: 'Reflects AAP's commitment': Arvind Kejriwal says projects launched by PM Modi 'joint ventures' of Delhi - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Reflects AAP's commitment’: Arvind Kejriwal says projects launched by PM Modi 'joint ventures' of Delhi government, Centre

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has remarked that the projects launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi should be considered as collaborative efforts between the Delhi government and the central government.

  • Kejriwal emphasized the cooperative relationship in executing public projects.
  • The discussion comes in the context of various infrastructure and development initiatives in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal has been advocating for joint projects that serve the public interest.
“These projects are not just initiated by the Centre; they involve our local governance as well,” said Kejriwal.

This stance aims to solidify AAP's role in key initiatives and reflect a positive image of collaboration in governance.

item.title: Real Estate Weekly Round Up: 30th December 2024- 5th January 2025 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Real Estate Weekly Round Up: 30th December 2024- 5th January 2025

Published on: January 5, 2025, Source: Live Law

This week in real estate, several significant decisions were made by regulatory authorities and tribunals regarding penalties and obligations of builders.

  • MahaREAT imposed a penalty of Rs. 5 lakhs on Spenta Builders for height restriction violations.
  • The definition of 'Promoter' under RERA 2016 was clarified, impacting redevelopment practices.
  • Haryana RERA directed Ansal Builders to hand over possession of properties and pay interest for delays.
  • Experion Developers were held liable for service deficiencies due to unreasonable contract conditions.
  • The Delhi State Commission ruled that buyers are not required to accept possession after unreasonable delays.
“Forfeiture of more than 10% of the basic sale price by the developer is unreasonable.” - National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

This week's rulings emphasize accountability in the real estate sector, directing builders to meet their obligations to buyers and adhere to regulatory standards.

item.title: What caused the recent unprecedented fog in Delhi-NCR? Decoding factors - Hindustan Times
item.description:
What Caused the Recent Unprecedented Fog in Delhi-NCR?

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The recent fog in Delhi-NCR has been described as unprecedented, severely affecting visibility and transportation. Meteorological factors, including a significant temperature drop and high humidity, contributed to these dense foggy conditions.

  • The fog caused zero visibility for an unprecedented nine-hour period.
  • Major disruptions included the delay of flights and trains.
  • Multiple factors such as temperature drop, low wind speeds, and high humidity contributed to the fog.
  • Pollution aggravated the fog situation by trapping pollutants close to the ground.
“Delhi's air quality was in the 'very poor' category, with an AQI reading of 372 at 9 am on Sunday.”

This unusual fog episode highlights the effects of weather phenomena combined with pollution and urban geography in the region.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal hits back at PM Modi: 'These projects wouldn't have been inaugurated if...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Responds to Modi's Criticisms Amid RRTS Inauguration

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heated exchange, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal defended his party against Prime Minister Modi's critiques following the inauguration of the Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor, emphasizing cooperation with the Centre despite ongoing tensions.

  • Kejriwal criticized PM Modi for using most of his speech to attack AAP rather than discussing development.
  • The RRTS corridor inauguration signifies direct connectivity from Meerut to Delhi.
  • Kejriwal claimed AAP's cooperation was vital for the inauguration of infrastructure projects.
  • The political rivalry intensifies as Delhi heads towards assembly elections.
“Today, the PM spoke for 38 minutes and he kept abusing the people of Delhi and the elected government for 29 minutes...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The confrontation highlights the ongoing political tensions as Delhi's assembly elections approach, with both leaders jockeying for public support.

item.title: Former Allahabad HC judge Mukul Jain appointed judicial member of SAT | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Former Allahabad HC judge Mukul Jain appointed judicial member of SAT

Date: 3 January 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Centre has appointed former Allahabad high court judge justice Mayank Kumar Jain as the second judicial member of the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT). Jain will serve a term of four years or until he reaches the age of 67, whichever comes first.

SAT, established under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) Act, serves as an appellate body for appeals against orders passed by Sebi. The tribunal handles cases related to insider trading, market manipulation, regulatory violations, and other matters under Sebi’s jurisdiction.

  • Justice Jain's appointment was formalized by the ministry of finance.
  • SAT currently operates with a single bench and plans to establish a second bench for timely resolutions.
  • Jain's judicial career began in 1990, and he has held significant positions in various judicial capacities.
“With the addition of Justice Jain, the SAT is expected to establish a second bench to expedite its growing caseload.”

This appointment aims to enhance the efficiency of the SAT amid increasing demand for its services in the securities market.

item.title: US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India - News18
item.description:
US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

American influencer Kristen Fischer highlights the cultural differences in dining traditions between India and the United States, particularly how meals signal the end of socializing in India compared to the US.

  • Fischer has been living in New Delhi since 2011.
  • In the US, food is served immediately upon guest arrival, while in India, meals are served later in the evening.
  • Fischer struggles with being hungry while waiting for meals when visiting friends.
  • She notes the cultural expectation to socialize before eating in India is a significant challenge for her.
  • Fischer reflects on experiences where dinner is served late, often after 11 PM.
“This was, and still is, the hardest cultural difference for me coming to India.” - Kristen Fischer

The cultural differences in dining traditions highlight the challenges faced by those adapting to new cultural norms while living abroad.

item.title: Leopard, three tigers die of Avian flu in Maharashtra’s Gorewada Rescue Centre - The Hindu
item.description:
Leopard, three tigers die of Avian flu in Maharashtra’s Gorewada Rescue Centre

Published Date: January 05, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Four animals, including three tigers and a leopard, have died due to H5N1 Avian Influenza at the Gorewada Rescue Centre in Nagpur, Maharashtra. A red alert has been issued by the Government of India to prepare zoos across the state for potential outbreaks.

  • Three tigers (one male, two females) and one female leopard died of the Avian Influenza virus.
  • The outbreak was confirmed by testing conducted by ICAR-NISHAD after the animals showed symptoms and died.
  • The Centre is implementing enhanced bio-security measures to prevent further outbreaks.
  • Symptoms in the affected animals included limping, vomiting, diarrhea, and respiratory issues.
  • Officials are ensuring isolation protocols and staff safety while conducting routine testing of local wildlife.
“H5N1 is a lethal virus but the other variants of the virus may not be this lethal and the animals can be saved on timely medical treatment.” - Shatanik Bhagwat, Divisional Manager, Gorewada Project

The event has prompted immediate actions for monitoring and bio-security across animal institutions in the region to prevent further spread of the virus.

item.title: Chargesheet Cannot Be Based On Bald Assertions Of Connivance: Supreme Court - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Chargesheet Cannot Be Based On Bald Assertions Of Connivance: Supreme Court

Publication Date: Date not specified | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has ruled that chargesheets cannot rely solely on vague accusations of connivance, emphasizing the need for substantial evidence. The verdict arose from an appeal against the Madhya Pradesh High Court regarding an FIR related to forgery and cheating.

  • The court underscored the necessity of intent for prosecutions related to multiple offences.
  • It highlighted that public servants can only be prosecuted if their actions are closely linked to their official duties.
  • The Court set aside the Madhya Pradesh High Court's previous judgment, stating the FIR did not establish a prima facie case.
“There is no inkling in the slightest...to suggest that the appellant had played a role in dereliction of his duty.”

This ruling reinforces the legal standards regarding chargesheets and public servants' protections in criminal proceedings.
